ab.title: Genesis 47
ab.l:
And Joseph came and told Pharaoh, and said,
‘My father and my brothers, and their flocks, and their cattle,
and all that they have, came out of the land of Canaan. And,
lo, they are in the land of Goshen.’

And he took some
of his brothers, five men, and presented them
before Pharaoh.

And Pharaoh said
to Jacob’s brothers, ‘What is your work?’ And they said to Pharaoh,
‘Your servants are shepherds, and our fathers, too.’

And they said to Pharaoh, ‘We came to live in the land
because your servants have no pasture for their flocks because
the famine became stronger in the land of Canaan. And now may your servants dwell
in the land of Goshen.’

And Pharaoh said
to Joseph, ‘Your father and your brothers have come to you.

The land of Egypt is before you.
Settle your father and your brothers in the better place of the land.
They shall dwell in the land of Goshen. And if you know,
or if there is any able men among them, then you shall make them
livestock superiors over those that are mine.’

And Joseph brought in Jacob his father, and
stood him before Pharaoh. And Jacob blessed
Pharaoh.

And Pharaoh said to Jacob, ‘How many
are the days of the years of your life?’

And Jacob said
to Pharaoh, ‘The days of the years of my life are a hundred and thirty years.
The days of the years of my life have been few and bad, and have not attained
to the days of the years of the life of my fathers, in the days of their life.’

And Jacob offered peace to Pharaoh, and
went out from before Pharaoh.

And Joseph settled
his father and his brothers, and gave them a possession
in the land of Egypt, in the better place of the land, in the land
of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.

And Joseph nourished his father, and his brothers, and
all the people of his father’s house, with bread,
according to the food of the little ones.

And there was no bread in all
the land, for the famine became very much stronger, so that the all the people of
the land of Egypt and of the land of Canaan went insane by reason of the famine.

And Joseph gathered up all the silver
that was found in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan
for the grain which they bought. And Joseph brought
the money to Pharaoh’s house.

And when the silver came to an end from the land of Egypt and from the land
of Canaan, all the Egyptians came to Joseph, saying,
‘Give us bread! And why should we die before you? Because
the silver came to an end.’

And Joseph said, ‘Give your livestock,
and I will give you bread for your livestock if the silver is gone.’

And they brought their livestock to Joseph,
and Joseph gave them bread for the horses, and for the multitude of
sheep, and for the multitude of cattle, and for the donkeys.
And he led them out with bread for all their livestock
in that year.

And that year was ended, and
they came to him the second year, and said to him, ‘We will not hide it
from my lord that in truth the silver has come to an end, and
my lord has the multitude of |our| livestock as well. There is nothing left before my lord,
but our bodies, and our lands.

Why shall we die
before your eyes, both we and our land? Buy us and
our land for bread, and we and our land will be servants to Pharaoh.
And give us seed, that we may live and not die, that the land
may not be ruined.

And Joseph bought all the land
of Egypt for Pharaoh, because the Egyptians sold every man his field,
because the famine prevailed over them. So the land became
Pharaoh’s.

And the people: he ordered them to go
to cities, from one edge of Egypt’s borders even to its |other| edge.

Only the land of the priests he did not buy,
because the priests had a portion assigned them of Pharaoh, and did eat
their portion which Pharaoh gave them. On account of this
they did not sell their land.

And
Joseph said to the people, ‘Lo, I have bought you
and your land for Pharaoh today. Lo, here is seed for you, and
you shall sow the land.

And it shall be, in the harvest,
that you shall give the fifth part to Pharaoh, and four
parts shall be your own, for field seed, and for your food,
and for them in your houses, and for food for your little ones.’

And they said, ‘You have revived us. Let us find favour
in the eyes of my lord, and we will be Pharaoh’s servants.’

And Joseph made it a statute to this day over the land
of Egypt, that Pharaoh should have up to the fifth part. Only the land
of the priests did not become Pharaoh’s.

And Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt, in the land
of Goshen. And they had possessions in it. And they spread,
and multiplied very much.
Parashat Vayechi

And Jacob lived
in the land of Egypt seventeen years. So the days
of Jacob, the days of his life, were a hundred and forty-seven years.

And Israel’s days to die drew close. And he called
his son Joseph, and said to him, ‘If, now, I have found
favour in your eyes, I pray you, put now your hand under my thigh, and do kindness and truth with me, I pray you, do not bury me in Egypt.

But let me lie by my fathers. And carry
me out of Egypt, and bury me in their cemetery.’ And
he said, ‘I will do according to your words.’

And
he said, ‘Swear to me.’ And he swore to him. And Israel bowed himself
at the head of the bed.
